messages.title: LABOUR - LEADING THE RECOVERY
messages.content: A recent BBC Poll asked 'Who do you most trust to take Wales forward to a strong economic recovery?' Gordon Brown/Cymru Jones 47%, David Cameron/Nick Bourne 24%, Ieuan Wyn Jones/Ieilyn Llwyd 14%, Nick Clegg/Kirsty Williams 9%, Don't Knows 6%

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Against downgrading of the HomeBuy scheme and supports more housing options for young families

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Ieuan Wyn Jones/Ieilyn Llwyd, David Cameron/Nick Bourne, Nick Clegg/Kirsty Williams
mentions.tacticalSituation: Remember! The records of the parties on Ynys Môn

issues.economy: Albert Owen trusted to lead economic recovery.

housing.content: Against downgrading of the HomeBuy scheme and supports more housing options for young families

leaflet.personalStatement: I have delivered on my pledge to Anglesey at every opportunity by raising issues I believe important like a strong promoter of major industries of the port, energy, sea and agriculture as well as public services and a proactive voice for all parts of the island. I have successfully lobbied to protect jobs and help local industries including Wylfa, Sea Products Wales and ensuring procurement contracts stay local, etc.

politicalExperience.role: Member of Parliament for Ynys Môn
politicalExperience.achievements: Raised issues important to Anglesey, lobbied to protect jobs and help local industries, engaged with all sectors including Wylfa and Sea Products Wales.

quotes.text: A strident, articulate campaigner and advocate for the people of his constituency.

images.caption: Albert Owen with a group of supporters.
Chart showing trust in party leaders to lead economic recovery.
Albert Owen working at his desk, on the phone.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Albert Owen was named 'Campaigner of the Year 2009' at the Welsh Politician of the Year Awards. He is respected MP with a reputation for 'standing up for Anglesey' and a 'strong local and experienced voice at Westminster'.
